messages.subject: Game: Uru: Ages Beyond Myst  (was Re: games- zoombinis)
messages.msgSnippet: Here s a game that s great fun and very challenging (and quite different from Zoombinies--those posts just got me to thinking about it). This one is not ...
messages.messageBody:
Here's a game that's great fun and very challenging (and quite different from
Zoombinies--those posts just got me to thinking about it). This one is not
:::sigh::: available for Mac, and even requires a pretty spiffy PC to work well (it's 3D),
but it's ~so~ wonderful! It's the newest Myst game. You can even customize the look
of your character that you take through all the adventures--clothes, shape,
complexion, color and length of hair--the choices are incredible, and you can even
customize facial features.

http://uru.ubi.com/us/

Lillian, a Mac user waiting for a Mac edition
http://www.BestHomeschooling.org






.

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] games- zoombinis
messages.msgSnippet: Yes, My son is 12 and he plays it and I am 33 and I play it. Some of the parts are more difficult than others. The bubble one is confusing to me but the
messages.messageBody:
Yes, My son is 12 and he plays it and I am 33 and I play it. Some of the
parts are more difficult than others. The bubble one is confusing to me but the
railroad carts are not though my daughter age 4 is the opposite. Laura
****************************************************

zoombinis. I am going to get it for sure.
Would an 11 almost 12 yr old like it too? I'll get it for my 8 yr old
anyway but am just curious.

Kathy

My 14yo and 12yo like it well enough. It is fun to
figure out the patterns, of course, they figure it out
faster than my 5yo.

But even though the game says 8+ as the age range, my
5yo plays it very well.

wifetovegman

messages.messageBody:

at Burlington Coat Factory yesterday! Too bad we already have it.

Is there another one out besides that one and Logical Journey? We have
both,but we'd like more.

Tuck

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] games- zoombinis
messages.msgSnippet: Zoombinis is awesome! My 4 yr. old plays it all the time as do I. We bought ours from a college student selling bundled games and books this summer.  I think
messages.messageBody:
Zoombinis is awesome! My 4 yr. old plays it all the time as do I. We bought
ours from a college student selling bundled games and books this summer. I
think we also got Might Math Numbers with it also.

BUT, today I was at Scholastic Books Warehouse sale and spotted them. I think
regular price was 14.00 so discount price for HSers and teachers is 7.00. Go
to www.scholastic.com and click teachers and then the link on the side for
the warehouse sales near you.

For those who do not know the scholastic sales we HSers/Unschoolers can
attend. Some ask for HS paperwork while others (here in Maine) never ask.
Everything on the shelves is 50% off and here there are like 8 double sided large
isles of books, pens pencils and some toys.

This is where we bought Dustin's Harry Potter books 1/2 off! Captain
Underpants, goosebumps, Box Car Kids and they also have Judy Bloom, books on America
etc....
Our sale has been for almost two weeks and ends this Friday.
Laura
*********************************************************************


<<<In a message dated 12/16/2003 7:17:53 PM Eastern Standard Time,
pamsoroosh@... writes:
Have a look at www.zoombinis.com <G>. Its a GREAT game. Wonderful
mathematical thinking material and, well, its just really fun!

You can get it from Amazon and also from lots of other places. Often
bundled with other games from The Learning Company.

-pam

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] games- zoombinis
messages.msgSnippet: We love zoombinis here! Don t wait to get it--even my 3.5 yo loves it. (I think the recommended age is 8 and up-bah!) A must have! I got Logical Journey
messages.messageBody:
We love zoombinis here! Don't wait to get it--even my 3.5 yo loves it. (I
think the recommended age is 8 and up-bah!)

A must have! I got Logical Journey together with Mountain Rescue from
Amazon. Start with Logical Journey, especially if your kids aren't really
reading yet because it reads the directions for each stage; Mountain Rescue
does not.

--danielle
